Job Posting: 176990 - Position: S26 GIS Planning Student 176990B Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 01/19/2026 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 01/12/2026 05:10 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country County of Brant PO Box 160, 26 Park Avenue Burford N0E 1A0 ON Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Salary Currency Salary Job Description 2026 - Summer S26 GIS Planning Student 176990B Co-op Position The County of Brant, ON Canada 4 or 8 months CAD 22.54 per hour for 35 Major List https://countyofbrant.applytojob.com/apply/wf6NNkZxqB/GIS-Planning-Student-48-Month-CoOp GIS Planning Student (4-8 Month Co-Op) The County of Brant, ON, Canada Temporary Development Services, Development Planning APPLY REPORTS TO: Director of Planning / Development Services GIS Analyst LOCATION: Initial Placement - Paris Administration Office Summary of Duties: Reports to and carries out work under the direction of the Director of Planning. Undertakes and assists staff in a variety of planning, environmental, and natural heritage-related assignments and studies, including research, survey, data-gathering, data maintenance, and data analysis. Provides graphic design assistance in the preparation of reports and studies. Work Performed: • Completes various data maintenance, editing and data updates as needed. • Undertakes research, survey, data-gathering, data monitoring, data analysis, and mapping analysis related to Planning and Development projects and processes. • Provides information to other planning staff, municipal departments, agencies, elected officials, community organizations and the general public. • Assists in the preparation of reports; and provides information to senior staff, pertaining to Planning assignments. • Assist with graphics in the preparation of reports and presentations. Develops illustrative urban design drawings, maps, and 3D modeling to assist Planning and Development staff in their projects. • Conducts, or assists in the preparation of studies, strategies, guidelines and projects relating to the long term planning for sustainable development of land, facilities and services, including the study of demographic, socio-economic, physical and environmental factors; solicits input from other departments, divisions, agencies and the public. • Provides information to other planning staff, municipal departments, agencies, elected officials, community organizations and the general public. Performs related duties as assigned. • Duration: May to August or May to December (35 hours/week) Job Requirements Qualifications: • Currently enrolled in a University or College GIS or Planning program, or related field. • Must be a current student enrolled in full-time studies returning to school full-time September 2026 and/or require this placement to graduate from an academic program. Specialized Training & Licenses: • Working knowledge in graphic design related software, such as Google SketchUp, AutoCAD, Adobe Create Suite (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop) and ArcGIS • Strong computer skills in Windows Office programs, particularly Word, Excel and PowerPoint. • Working understanding of planning legislation, and planning, natural heritage, sustainability and resiliency principles and practices would be an asset. • Valid Driver's License is an asset. • Excellent verbal and written communication skills. You must be enrolled in a post-secondary Institution and returning to school the following semester to qualify for this position with the exception of completing a final co-op term. Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Yes Address Cover Letter to Hiring Manager Special Application Instructions Please use to the link below to apply- https://countyofbrant.applytojob.com/apply/wf6NNkZxqB/GIS-Planning-Student-48-Month-CoOp Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
